links.title: Brave taps Binance for crypto trading widget in browser - Decrypt
links.description: News Technology Image: Shutterstock In brief Brave added Binance crypto buying, selling, and trading to its web browser. messages.body:
$BNB.X Buying binance coin hand over fist. With 2bln spot volumes on average the past 30 days. The revenue is 3mln per day, i.e. 1,1bln per year. With roughly 50% profit margin that is 550mln$ profit and 20% going to burn that is 110mln for burn. With 12$ per coin we burn 9mln coins. On total remaining supply of 183mln that is 5% yield. Assume 100% payout that is a 25% yield on ROE. No debt. Cash at hand is probably >1bln (this is probably in bitcoin/eth/usdt/bnb denominated retained earnings). So extracting those profits, the business is even cheaper. Powerhouse. Big risk: no share of course, relies on faith in Changpeng that he will reward coinholders.  
 
In my calculation on the other side, I am conservative, excluding futures & margin revenues (and IEO, and WazirX and FTT related profits/expenses).

links.title: Liquidity Crisis Continues: BitMEX Wick Reaches $8,700 on Bitcoin Futures
links.description: Last week, Bitcoin plummeted from $7,500 to $3,800 at the extreme point of the low, as a result of a coronavirus panic-induced selloff combined with a liquidity crisis and potential DDoS attack on BitMEX that created a cascade of liquidations driving the price of Bitcoin down at a rapid rate.

messages.body: $BNB.X Binance has over >1bln$ in cumulative profits. So with a current marketcap of 183mln total coins * 12,80$= 2,3bln. This means that we are at twice cash booklevel. With profits of ~300mln per year. And Q1 2020 has a higher runrate than the ~70mln per quarter due to the higher volumes. Impact of binance cloud is also underestimated imho, imagine banks and brokers connecting to binance cloud to offer crypto trades to their customers. Benefitting from the current liquidity in the binance orderbooks. Binance on its way to become the NASDAQ of crypto.

Binance adds P2P trading for 5 Latin American fiat currencies $BNB.X
► https://decrypt.co/?p=22942

links.title: Binance adds P2P trading for 5 Latin American fiat currencies - Decrypt
links.description: Binance, the leading crypto exchange by volume, announced on Tuesday that it now supports five new fiat currencies from Latin America on its peer-to-peer (P2P) trading platform. The fiat currencies added were the Brazilian real (BRL), Argentine peso (ARS), Colombian peso (COP), Mexican peso (MXN), and Peruvian sol (PEN).

Binance Launches $50M ‘Blockchain for India’ Fund
https://faws.com/news/26328117
$BNB.X

links.title: Binance Launches $50M 'Blockchain for India' Fund
links.description: Binance and its local subsidiary have set up a new fund to reinvigorate growth in blockchain startups in India following a Supreme Court decision to allow banks to service crypto firms. Binance and India-based bitcoin exchange WazirX - which Binance acquired last November - announced Tuesday their new "Blockchain for India" fund would incubate and invest in local startups that contribute to the creation of a sophisticated cryptocurrency and blockchain ecosystem for the subcontinent.

messages.body: $BNB.X Binance coin is a steal now, with record volumes and massive profits. I expect them to be trading at almost tangible book value (as far as you can speak of book value with crypto). Their total profits are <1bln$. However, those profits probably sit in BTC, ETH and BNB mostly. Those dipped as well ofcourse. Their reserves must be at least 500mln. Now, current marketcap is 1,5bln. With 500mln of cash, we are left with 1bln marketcap. At 400mln profit per year (and I expect that to increase in 2020 due to massive volumes, also FY futures revenue) the P/E is <3. And they do way more than only trading at the moment. A steal IMHO at any price below 10$. Disclaimer: LONG BNB and very risky 'asset' ofcourse. FULLBULL
